data.title: What's new to watch on BBC iPlayer?
data.meta_description: From drama to comedy, documentaries, entertainment and more, find out what's new on BBC iPlayer
data.text:
New in this week, we have four new famous faces embark on an epic race of a lifetime across South America in a new series of Celebrity Race Across the World, thereâs a story of the most unlikely cricket tour that almost didnât happen in Freddie Flintoffâs Field of Dreams.

Our Pretty Little Liars are back for a second season in Summer School, new factual drama Kidnapped: The Chloe Ayling Story tells the tale of an individual accused of faking her own kidnapping and her plight for justice, and finally, join us for dating, disaster and failed romances in new comedy â Daddy Issues.

What's coming new to BBC iPlayer this week?

Celebrity Race Across the World

Four new famous faces embark on an epic 12,500 km race of a lifetime across South America, from BelÃ©m in Northern Brazil to Frutillar in the Andes in Southern Chile. The celebs this time include broadcaster Jeff Brazier and his son, Freddy, actor Kola Bokinni and his cousin, Mary Ellen, broadcaster Kelly Brook and her husband, Jeremy, and Radio 2 host Scott Mills and his husband, Sam.

Watch the new series of Celebrity Race Across the World from Wednesday 14 August on BBC iPlayer

Watch Race Across the World on BBC iPlayer now

Read more: Celebrity Race Across The World 2024 line-up reveal their biggest challenges, winning strategies and secrets that might surprise viewers

Freddie Flintoffâs Field of Dreams on Tour

After transforming a cricket club and the lives of teenagers in his hometown of Preston, Freddie and the boys are back in this four part series for BBC One and iPlayer. In 2022 Freddie had an ambitious plan to take the team he created to compete in India, one of the most revered cricketing nations in the world. Two years in the making, this is the story of the most unlikely cricket tour that almost didnât happen.

Watch Freddie Flintoffâs Field of Dreams on Tour from Tuesday 13 August on BBC iPlayer

Watch series one now on BBC iPlayer

Pretty Little Liars: Summer School

Our Pretty Little Liars are back for a second season (the sequel to Pretty Little Liars: Original Sin) and now face a fate worse than death â Summer School. A new villain, who may or may not have a connection to A, has come to town and is going to put them all to the test.

Watch Pretty Little Liars: Summer School from Tuesday 13 August on BBC iPlayer

Watch Pretty Little Liars: Original Sin on BBC iPlayer now

Kidnapped: The Chloe Ayling Story

Accused of faking her own kidnapping, and plunged into the centre of a media storm, this factual drama asks why Chloe Ayling was blamed for her kidnappersâ crimes. How does it feel to be an ordinary person, caught up in events so extraordinary that you arenât believed?

Watch Kidnapped: The Chloe Ayling Story from Wednesday 14 August on BBC iPlayer

Daddy Issues

Comedy. From dating disasters and failed romances through to toxic friendship sand messy family dynamics, plus a dangerously sociopathic antenatal teacher, Daddy Issues is an big hearted story about a father and daughter, and the reality of facing up to parenthood - at any stage of life.

Watch Daddy Issues from Thursday 15 August on BBC iPlayer

Read more: Daddy Issues' Aimee Lou Wood and David Morrissey on their new comedy: "One of the big problems we have working together is that we make each other laugh"

What's new to watch on BBC iPlayer now?

To know criminals' minds you have to get close to murder. A brilliant young doctor takes on mysterious cases in bohemian Vienna Blood.

Watch Vienna Blood on BBC iPlayer. New episodes from Sunday 4 August

Read more: Vienna Blood cast and creatives on series 4 of the gripping crime drama

Corridors of Power: Should America Police the World?

US support for Iraq during the Iran-Iraq war ignored massacres, such as widespread use of chemical weapons against both the Iranians and the Kurdish ethnic minority in Iraq, as Washington maintained its close relationship with Baghdad. But with the end of the Cold War, Saddam Husseinâs invasion of Kuwait turned his American ally into an enemy. Would the US now intervene to help the Kurds?

Rare archive and in-depth testimony from decision makers gives insight to the workings of the inner sanctums of the White House to better understand not the âwhatâ, but the âwhy.â

Featuring interviews with leading US political figures, including Madeleine Albright, James Baker, Condoleezza Rice, Colin Powell and Hillary Clinton, the series, narrated by Meryl Streep and directed by Academy Award Â® nominee Dror Moreh, focuses on a 25 year period that reveals how our past can dictate our future.

Watch Corridors of Power: Should America Police the World? from Tuesday 6 August on BBC iPlayer

A Kanneh-Mason Playlist at the Promsâ¯

Superstar siblings Sheku and Braimah Kanneh-Mason, with Brazilian guitarist PlÃ­nio Fernandes and the dynamic Fantasia Orchestra, perform an eclectic and surprising mix from Brahms to Bob Marley.

The concert is made up of a range of music inspired by Sheku and Braimahâs inspirations and PlÃ­nioâs Brazilian roots. With songs born from folk, reggae and soul, expect unique arrangements of much loved hits such as I Say A Little Prayer, Redemption Song, The Girl From Ipanema, and Brahmsâ Hungarian Dances.

The dynamicâ¯Fantasia Orchestraâ¯makes its Proms debut under its founder,â¯Tom Fetherstonhaugh.

Watch A Kanneh-Mason Playlist at the Proms from Friday 9 August on iPlayer

Read more: BBC Proms 2024 - How to watch on TV and BBC iPlayer and listen on BBC Radio 3 and BBC Sounds

Country Music Summer Festival

Superstars Ashley McBryde and Jelly Roll host CMA Fest, with all the biggest moments direct from Nashville TN, with performances by Chris Stapleton, Lainey Wilson, Keith Urban, Post Malone, Shaboozey and more.

Watch Country Music Summer Festival on BBC iPlayer

Radio 1 Dance Weekend

As part of BBC Radio 1âs Dance Weekend, BBC Radio 1 returns to Ibiza and 528 for another huge night of the best dance acts â with a live stream on BBC iPlayer across 2/3 August and selected individual sets available on demand.

Watch Radio 1 Dance Weekend from Saturday 3 August on BBC iPlayer

Interview with the Vampire

A sumptuous reinvention of Anne Rice's epic tale of seduction, blood and immortality. Life after death will never be the same. Starring Jacob Anderson and Sam Reid.

Watch Interview with the Vampire now on BBC iPlayer

Miriam Margolyes: A New Australian Adventure

Miriam wants to embrace change and be open to reinventing herself, if she wants to stay relevant and connected. So to give herself a kickstart by returning to Australia in search of new possibilities. This time, sheâll meet a whole host of colourful characters and head to three places sheâs always wanted to explore: Perth, Broken Hill and Byron Bay. All three are iconic locations that epitomise the things she loves about Australia; but are they also, like her, in the throes of change?

Watch Miriam Margolyes: A New Australian Adventure now on BBC iPlayer

Read more: Miriam Margolyes on A New Australian Adventure - "Everything that's happened to me has happened because I walked towards life rather than away from it"

Atomic People

Atomic People, a landmark film for BBC Two and iPlayer, explores the human fallout from the first and last atomic bombs used in an act of war. Thus unique film gathers the testimony of some of the last âHibakushaâ - survivors of the two atomic bombs â before their voices are lost forever.

With an average age of 85, most Hibakusha were children when the bombs were dropped. Combining their personal accounts with archive footage, âAtomic Peopleâ features a significant number of voices from this shrinking group - the only people left on earth to have survived a nuclear bomb â whilst exploring how their experiences continue to affect them to this day.

Watch Atomic People now on BBC iPlayer

Stacey Dooley Sleeps Over

Break out the sofa bed - Stacey's coming to stay. She's getting a taste of family life in all its ordinary, extraordinary shapes - from a cage-fighting teen to an ageing dominatrix.

Watch Stacey Dooley Sleeps Over now on BBC iPlayer

Olympics: Paris 2024

The worldâs biggest sporting event takes centre stage in the city of love, with access to all 32 events at Paris 2024, a nightly highlights programme, and Olympics Extra, a fully scheduled live stream following the biggest moments across every event all on iPlayer.

Watch Olympics: Paris 2024 on BBC iPlayer

Read more: Olympic Games 2024 Paris - How to watch on TV and BBC iPlayer and follow all the Olympics action across Radio, BBC Sounds and BBC Sport Online

Linford

Documentary with unfettered access to athlete, Linford Christie, as he talks exclusively about the highs and lows of a glittering athletics career, from the glory of winning Olympic gold to the impact of failing a drugs test after coming out of retirement for one last race.

Watch Linford on BBC iPlayer

Read more: Linford Christie reflects on his career ahead of new BBC film - âIt has made me appreciate how far I have comeâ

Sneakerhead

Sitcom set in Sports Depot, a fictional sports shop in Peterborough, Cambridgeshire following the antics of Russell, a confirmed sneakerhead, and his fellow long-suffering employees. Starring Hugo Chegwin and Big Zuu.

Watch Sneakerhead on BBC iPlayer

The Hundred

The summer of sport continues on BBC iPlayerâ¦ Eight teams. A hundred balls. The fast-paced, action-packed cricket tournament featuring the game's biggest names.

Watch The Hundred on BBC iPlayer

Hell Jumper

This is the story of the war in Ukraine as youâve never seen it, captured through the eyes and the extraordinary first-person footage of a group of volunteers saving strangersâ lives in one of the most dangerous places on Earth.

Watch Hell Jumper on BBC iPlayer

The Jetty

When a fire tears through a holiday home in a scenic Lancashire lake town, Detective Ember Manning (Jenna Coleman) must work out how it connects to a podcast journalist investigating a missing persons cold case and an illicit âloveâ triangle between a man in his twenties and two underage girls. But as Ember gets close to the truth, it threatens to destroy her life â forcing her to re-evaluate everything she thought she knew about her past, present and the town sheâs always called home.

As much a coming-of-age story as a detective thriller, The Jetty asks big questions about sexual morality, identity and memory, in the places that Me Too has left behind.

Watch The Jetty on BBC iPlayer

Read more: Jenna Coleman and the cast of The Jetty discuss the detective thriller

First Night of the Proms

Clive Myrie and special guests launch the 2024 BBC Proms season with Beethovenâs famous Fifth Symphony. A dazzling all-female line-up features pianist extraordinaire Isata Kanneh-Mason, superstar soprano Sophie Bevan and acclaimed conductor Elim Chan.

Elim, conducting her First Night debut, kicks off eight weeks of glorious music with an electrifying programme that also includes Handelâs Music for Royal Fireworks and a world premiere from 27-year-old composer Ben Nobuto.

Sophie Bevan makes a triumphant return to the Proms with Brucknerâs jubilant Psalm 150, and Isata Kanneh-Mason performs a tender and lyrical piano concerto by Clara Schumann, a composer she has championed tirelessly.

Theyâre joined by the BBC Symphony Orchestra, BBC Symphony Chorus and BBC Singers.

Watch First Night of the Proms on BBC iPlayer

Read more: Find out how to watch The Proms on TV and BBC iPlayer

Read more: Find out more about The BBC Proms 2024

High Country

A fictional story inspired by true events, High Country is an eight-part thriller that revolves around detective Andrea (Andie) Whitford, who is transferred to the Victorian High Country and thrust into a baffling mystery of five missing persons who have vanished into the wilderness. Through an edge-of-the-seat, high-stakes investigation, Andie uncovers a complex web involving murder, deceit and revenge.

Watch High Country on BBC iPlayer

Ghosts US

Samantha and Jay throw caution to the wind when they convert their recently inherited country estate into a bed-and-breakfast. Call it mislaid plans. Not only is the place falling apart, but itâs also inhabited by spirits of previous residents â whom only Samantha can see and hear. Ghosts spins the funny, heartfelt story about a newfound dream that reveals connection and self-discovery aren't just for the living.

Life and the afterlife changes at Woodstone after one of the ghosts ascends to heaven leaving Sam and Jay along with the rest of the ghosts must learn how to adapt to this change.

Watch all episodes of Ghosts US on BBC iPlayer

Daley: Olympic Superstar

Daley is the definitive feature documentary of the life of double Olympic decathlon champion, Daley Thompson.

With unprecedented access and never before seen archive, the film chronicles his legendary sporting achievements, but, for the first time, also reveals the personal struggles he faced to rise from the humblest of beginnings to become the ultimate Olympian; a Superstar who then has to reconcile what it took to become the greatest all around athlete in the world with his own humanity as a son and as a father.

Watch Daley: Olympic Superstar on BBC iPlayer

Like, Follow, Trafficked: Instaâs Fake Guru

BBC Eye Investigations and BBC News Brasil uncover the truth behind the rise of wellness influencer and spiritual life coach, Kat Torres, and the desperate search for her enslaved and trafficked followers.

Watch Like, Follow, Trafficked: Instaâs Fake Guru on BBC iPlayer Monday 15 July

Spent

Part-inspired by her own experiences of the modelling industry and the trials and tribulations that come along with it, Michelle de Swarte stars as Mia, a former catwalk model who is on the run, mainly from herself.

Long term itâs a story of personal renewal but for now, the stark reality is that her career is over, sheâs flat broke and sheâs homeless. This is a woman who despite her humble beginnings has become accustomed, possibly even addicted, to the finer things in life. Unfortunately, those lifestyle choices donât carry much currency when youâre pushing 40 and permanently sofa surfing.

She may have a highfalutinâ attitude and a world class skincare regime but Miaâs now living on the breadline. Not that sheâs prepared to admit that to anyone, not even herself.

Watch Spent on BBC iPlayer

The Turkish Detective

Set in the multi-faceted city of Istanbul, The Turkish Detective follows the adventures of Inspector Ãetin Ikmen (Bilginer), his partner Detective Mehmet SÃ¼leyman (Kai) and Detective AyÅe FarsakoÄlu (Allen) going through ups and downs as they solve crimes, with each crime story being heavily rooted in the varied culture and history of Istanbul and set against the frenzied world of modern-day Turkey.

Watch The Turkish Detective on BBC iPlayer

Cooking Buddies

Cooking Buddies sees Buddy Oliver and young guests swap skills as he shows them how to make simple meals and they show him something theyâre good at - like basketball, ice skating or salsa dancing.

Buddy shares his passion for cooking and teaches his new friends how to make dishes such as spicy tomato pasta, pizza and crispy chicken. He also gives his guests and viewers helpful tips in everything from chopping techniques to ingredient swaps.

With surprise appearances from the Oliver family, Cooking Buddies promises an engaging culinary adventure for young chefs and their families. Buddy and friends are also joined in his den by the Oliver family dog, border collie Conker, who is voiced by actor and comedian John Sparkes.

Watch Cooking Buddies on BBC iPlayer

Read more: Jamie Oliverâs son Buddy teaches kids to make easy, delicious meals in Cooking Buddies - "Making the TV show was epic"

A Good Girl's Guide to Murder

Five years ago schoolgirl Andie Bell was murdered by her boyfriend Sal Singh. Case closed. The police know he did it. Everyone in town knows he did it. But smart and single-minded Pip Fitz-Amobi isn't so sure and sheâs determined to prove it. If Sal Singh isnât a murderer and the real killer is still out there, how far will they go to keep Pip from the truth?

Watch A Good Gir's Guide to Murder on BBC iPlayer

Read more: A Good Girl's Guide to Murder - author Holly Jackson and the cast on staying true to the books and the big scenes fans will recognise

Paddy & Molly: Show No Mersey

Follow Liverpool natives and best friends, Paddy and Molly, two charismatic MMA fighters who are making a massive impact in UFC, which is hailed as one of the fastest growing sports in the world.

This frank, funny and up-close series follows Paddy and Mollyâs journey inside and outside of the cage as they take on the biggest fights of their lives - which will determine their legacy in the MMA world - all whilst juggling their relationships with friends and family.

Watch Paddy and Molly: Show No Mersey on BBC iPlayer

Read more: Paddy âThe Baddyâ Pimblett and Molly âMeatballâ McCann on reality series Show No Mersey - "You really will get to see the blood, sweat and tears"

BMX All Stars

A trainer tries to make his way as an instructor at a gym where the clientele doesn't take physical fitness very seriously.

Watch Peacock on BBC iPlayer

The Traitors US

In this gripping new series, Radio 1 presenter Sian Eleri investigates a series of strange events that began with a UFO sighting by 14 schoolboys which triggered a wave of âclose encountersâ and claims of the biggest mass sighting in British history.

The case made headlines around the World when along the south and west coast of Wales over several years the 1970s and 1980s, dozens of ordinary and unconnected people in seaside resorts and rural villages reported a spate of unexplained and terrifying sightings. Reports ranged from a UFO sighting by 14 schoolboys, to a local hotelier claiming she saw a spaceship. A wave of reports of close encounters in the area followed, resulting in claims of Britainâs biggest ever mass sighting.

Sianâs first mission is to track down the schoolboys whose âalienâ encounter in the village of Broad Haven, Pembrokeshire triggered it all. With access to the original investigatorâs case archive which had been locked away and to those at the heart of the case, Sian sets out to uncover what really happened. She starts out as a sceptic, but in a series of chilling and increasingly bizarre twists and turns, Sian is left questioning everything she thought she knew.

Watch Paranormal The Village That Saw Aliens on BBC iPlayer

Watch Paranormal The Girl, the Ghost and the Gravestone on BBC iPlayer
